name: eles.classes
descr: Get or replace the current list of classes on the elements with the specified list.

formats.name: ele.classes
formats.descr: Get the list of classes as an array for the element.

formats.name: eles.classes
formats.descr: Replace the list of classes for all elements in the collection.

args.name: classes
args.descr: An array (or a space-separated string) of class names that replaces the current class list.

name: eles.addClass
descr: Add classes to elements.  The classes should be specified in the [stylesheet](#style) in order to have an effect on the rendered style of the elements.

args.name: classes
args.descr: An array (or a space-separated string) of class names to add to the elements.

name: eles.hasClass
descr: Get whether an element has a particular class.

args.name: className
args.descr: The name of the class to test for.

name: eles.toggleClass
descr: Toggle whether the elements have the specified classes.  The classes should be specified in the [stylesheet](#style) in order to have an effect on the rendered style of the elements.

args.name: classes
args.descr: An array (or a space-separated string) of class names to toggle on the elements.

args.name: toggle
args.descr: Instead of automatically toggling, adds the classes on truthy values or removes them on falsey values.

name: eles.removeClass
descr: Remove classes from elements.  The classes should be specified in the [stylesheet](#style) in order to have an effect on the rendered style of the elements.

args.name: classes
args.descr: An array (or a space-separated string) of class names to add to the elements.

name: eles.flashClass
descr: Add classes to the elements, and then remove the classes after a specified duration.

args.name: classes
args.descr: An array (or a space-separated string) of class names to flash on the elements.

args.name: duration
args.descr: The duration in milliseconds that the classes should be added on the elements. After the duration, the classes are removed.

name: eles.allAre
descr: Determine whether all elements in the collection match a selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector to match against.

name: eles.is
descr: Determine whether any element in this collection matches a selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector to match against.

name: eles.some
descr: Determine whether any element in this collection satisfies the specified test function.

formats.descr: Listen to events that bubble up from elements matching the specified node selector:

args.name: function(ele,i,eles)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The event object.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being tested.

args.descr: The test function that returns truthy values for elements that satisfy the test and falsey values for elements that do not satisfy the test.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the test function.

name: eles.every
descr: Determine whether all elements in this collection satisfy the specified test function.

args.name: function(ele,i,eles)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The event object.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being tested.

args.descr: The test function that returns truthy values for elements that satisfy the test and falsey values for elements that do not satisfy the test.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the test function.

name: eles.same
descr: Determine whether this collection contains exactly the same elements as another collection.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other elements to compare to.

name: eles.anySame
descr: Determine whether this collection contains any of the same elements as another collection.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other elements to compare to.

name: eles.allAreNeighbors
descr: Determine whether all elements in the specified collection are in the neighbourhood of the calling collection.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other elements to compare to.

name: eles.contains
descr: Determine whether this collection contains all of the elements of another collection.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The other elements to compare to.

name: nodes.parent
descr: Get the compound parent node of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.commonAncestors
descr: Get all compound ancestors common to all the nodes in the collection, starting with the closest and getting progressively farther.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.orphans
descr: Get all orphan (i.e. has no compound parent) nodes in the calling collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.nonorphans
descr: Get all nonorphan (i.e. has no compound parent) nodes in the calling collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.children
descr: Get all compound child (i.e. direct descendant) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.siblings
descr: Get all sibling (i.e. same compound parent) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.isParent
descr: Get whether the node is a compound parent (i.e. a node containing one or more child nodes)

name: nodes.isChildless
descr: Get whether the node is childless (i.e. a node with no child nodes)

name: nodes.isChild
descr: Get whether the node is a compound child (i.e. contained within a node)

name: nodes.isOrphan
descr: Get whether the node is an orphan (i.e. a node with no parent)

name: nodes.descendants
descr: Get all compound descendant (i.e. children, children's children, etc.) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.absoluteComplement
descr: Get all elements in the graph that are not in the calling collection.

name: eles.diff
descr: Perform a traditional left/right diff on the two collections.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The elements on the right side of the diff.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector representing the elements on the right side of the diff. All elements in the graph matching the selector are used as the passed collection.

name: eles.unmerge
descr: Perform an in-place operation on the calling collection to remove the given elements.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The elements to remove in-place.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector representing the elements to remove. All elements in the graph matching the selector are used as the passed collection.

name: eles.map
descr: Get an array containing values mapped from the collection.

args.name: function(ele,i,eles)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being mapped.

args.descr: The function that returns the mapped value for each element.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

name: eles.reduce
descr: Reduce a single value by applying a function against an accumulator and each value of the collection.

args.name: function(prevVal,ele,i,eles)

fields.name: prevVal
fields.descr: The value accumulated from previous elements.

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being reduced.

args.descr: The function that returns the accumulated value given the previous value and the current element.

name: eles.max
descr: Find a maximum value and the corresponding element.

args.name: function(ele,i,eles)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being searched.

args.descr: The function that returns the value to compare for each element.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

name: eles.min
descr: Find a minimum value and the corresponding element.

args.name: function(ele,i,eles)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being searched.

args.descr: The function that returns the value to compare for each element.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

name: nodes.isNode
descr: Get whether the element is a node.

name: nodes.isEdge
descr: Get whether the element is an edge.

name: nodes.isLoop
descr: Get whether the edge is a loop (i.e. same source and target).

name: nodes.isSimple
descr: Get whether the edge is simple (i.e. different source and target).

name: nodes.group
descr: Get the group string that defines the type of the element.

name: eles.forEach
descr: Iterate over the elements in the collection.

args.name: function(ele,i,eles)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being searched.

args.descr: The function executed each iteration.

args.name: thisArg
args.descr: The value for `this` within the iterating function.

name: nodes.toArray
descr: Get the collection as an array, maintaining the order of the elements.

name: eles.slice
descr: Get a subset of the elements in the collection based on specified indices.

args.name: start
args.descr: An integer that specifies where to start the selection. The first element has an index of 0. Use negative numbers to select from the end of an array.

args.name: end
args.descr: An integer that specifies where to end the selection. If omitted, all elements from the start position and to the end of the array will be selected. Use negative numbers to select from the end of an array.

name: eles.size
descr: Get the number of elements in the collection.

name: eles.eq
descr: Get an element at a particular index in the collection.

formats.name: eles.eq
formats.descr: Get the index of the element.

args.name: index
args.descr: The index of the element to get.

formats.name: eles.first
formats.descr: Get the first element in the collection.

formats.name: eles.last
formats.descr: Get the last element in the collection.

name: eles.empty
descr: Get whether the collection is empty, meaning it has no elements.

formats.name: eles.empty
formats.descr: Get whether the collection is empty.

formats.name: eles.nonempty
formats.descr: Get whether the collection is nonempty.

name: eles.sort
descr: Get a new collection containing the elements sorted by the specified comparison function.

args.name: function(ele1,ele2)
args.descr: Get a new collection containing the elements sorted by the specified comparison function.

name: node.layoutDimensions
descr: Get the node width and height. This function is intended for use in layout positioning to do overlap detection.

args.name: options
args.descr: The layout options object.

name: nodes.layoutPositions
descr: Position the nodes for a discrete/synchronous layout.

args.name: layout
args.descr: The layout.

args.name: options
args.descr: The layout options object.

args.name: function(ele,i)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The node being iterated over for which the function should return a position to set.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current node while iterating over the nodes in the layout.

args.descr: A function that returns the new position for the specified node.

name: eles.layout
descr: Get a new layout, which can be used to algorithmically position the nodes in the collection.

args.name: options
args.descr: The layout options.

name: ele.numericStyle
descr: Get the numeric value of a style property in preferred units that can be used for calculations.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the style property to get.

name: ele.numericStyleUnits
descr: Get the units that `ele.numericStyle()` is expressed in, for a particular property.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the style property to get.

name: eles.style
descr: Get or override the style of the element.

formats.name: ele.style
formats.descr: Get a name-value pair object containing visual style properties and their values for the element.

formats.name: ele.style
formats.descr: Get a particular style property value.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the visual style property to get.

formats.name: eles.style
formats.descr: Set a particular style property value.

args.name: name
args.descr: The name of the visual style property to set.

args.name: value
args.descr: The value of the visual style property to set.

formats.name: eles.style
formats.descr: Set several particular style property values.

args.name: obj
args.descr: An object of style property name-value pairs to set.

args.name: names
args.descr: A space-separated list of property names to remove overrides.

name: ele.effectiveOpacity
descr: Get the effective opacity of the element (i.e. on-screen opacity), which takes into consideration parent node opacity.

name: ele.transparent
descr: Get whether the element's effective opacity is completely transparent, which takes into consideration parent node opacity.

name: nodes.roots
descr: From the set of calling nodes, get the nodes which are roots (i.e. no incoming edges, as in a directed acyclic graph).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.leaves
descr: From the set of calling nodes, get the nodes which are leaves (i.e. no outgoing edges, as in a directed acyclic graph).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.outgoers
descr: Get edges (and their targets) coming out of the nodes in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.successors
descr: Recursively get edges (and their targets) coming out of the nodes in the collection (i.e. the outgoers, the outgoers' outgoers, ...).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.incomers
descr: Get edges (and their sources) coming into the nodes in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: nodes.predecessors
descr: Recursively get edges (and their sources) coming into the nodes in the collection (i.e. the incomers, the incomers' incomers, ...).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: edge.source
descr: Get source node of this edge.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: edge.target
descr: Get target node of this edge.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: edge.sources
descr: Get source nodes connected to the edges in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: edge.targets
descr: Get target nodes connected to the edges in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

name: cy.add
descr: Add elements to the graph and return them

formats.descr: Add a specified element to the graph.

args.name: eleObj
args.descr: A plain object that specifies the element.

formats.descr: Add the specified elements to the graph.

args.name: eleObjs
args.descr: An array of elements specified by plain objects.

formats.descr: Add the specified elements to the graph.

args.name: eles
args.descr: A collection of elements.

name: cy.remove
descr: Remove elements from the graph and return them.

args.name: eles
args.descr: A collection of elements to remove.

formats.descr: Remove elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: Elements matching this selector are removed.

name: cy.destroyed
descr: Get whether the instance of Cytoscape.js has been destroyed or not.

formats.descr: Run a callback as soon as the graph becomes ready (i.e. intitial data loaded and initial layout completed).  If the graph is already ready, then the callback is called immediately.  If data is loaded synchronously and the layout used is discrete/synchronous/unanimated/unspecified, then you don't need `cy.ready()`.

args.name: function(event)

fields.name: event
fields.descr: The `ready` event.

args.descr: The callback run as soon as the graph is ready.

name: cy.destroy
descr: A convenience function to explicitly destroy the instance.

name: cy.getElementById
descr: Get an element from its ID in a very performant way

args.name: id
args.descr: The ID of the element to get.

name: cy.container
descr: Get the HTML DOM element in which the graph is visualised. A null value is returned if the instance is headless.

name: cy.mount
descr: Attaches the instance to the specified container for visualisation.

args.name: container
args.descr: A HTML DOM element in which the graph should be rendered.

name: cy.unmount
descr: Remove the instance from its current container.

name: cy.json
descr: Import or export the graph in the same JSON format used at initialisation.

args.name: flatEles
args.descr: Whether the resulant JSON should include the elements as a flat array (`true`) or as two keyed arrays by group (`false`, default).

formats.descr: Import the graph as JSON, updating only the fields specified.

args.name: cyJson
args.descr: The object with the fields corresponding to the states that should be changed.

name: cy.layout
descr: Get a new layout, which can be used to algorithmically position the nodes in the graph

args.name: options
args.descr: The layout options.

name: cy.batch
descr: Allow for manipulation of elements without triggering multiple style calculations or multiple redraws.

args.name: function()
args.descr: A callback within which you can make batch updates to elements.

formats.name: cy.startBatch
formats.descr: Starts batching manually (useful for asynchronous cases).

formats.name: cy.endBatch
formats.descr: Ends batching manually (useful for asynchronous cases).

name: cy.collection
descr: Return a new, empty collection.

name: cy.$
descr: Get elements in the graph matching a selector or a filter function.

formats.name: cy.$
formats.descr: Get elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the elements should match.

formats.name: cy.elements
formats.descr: Get elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the elements should match.

formats.name: cy.nodes
formats.descr: Get nodes in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the nodes should match.

formats.name: cy.edges
formats.descr: Get edges in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the edges should match.

formats.name: cy.filter
formats.descr: Get elements in the graph matching the specified selector.

args.name: selector
args.descr: The selector the elements should match.

formats.name: cy.filter
formats.descr: Get elements in the graph matching the specified filter function.

args.name: function(ele,i,eles)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element under consideration for filtering.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The counter used for iteration over the elements in the graph.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: The collection of elements being filtered

args.descr: The filter function that returns true for elements that should be returned.

name: cy.style
descr: Get the entry point to modify the visual style of the graph after initialisation.

formats.descr: Assign a new stylesheet to replace the existing one.

args.name: stylesheet
args.descr: Either a `cytoscape.stylesheet()` object, a string stylesheet, or a JSON stylesheet (the same formats accepted for [`options.style`](#style) at initialisation).

name: cy.autolock
descr: Get or set whether nodes are automatically locked (i.e. if `true`, nodes are locked despite their individual state).

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables autolocking; a falsey value disables it.

name: cy.autoungrabify
descr: Get or set whether nodes are automatically ungrabified (i.e. if `true`, nodes are ungrabbale despite their individual state).

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables autoungrabifying; a falsey value disables it.

name: cy.autounselectify
descr: Get or set whether nodes are automatically unselectified (i.e. if `true`, nodes are ungrabbale despite their individual state).

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables autounselectifying; a falsey value disables it.

name: cy.selectionType
descr: Get or set the selection type.  The `'single'` selection type is the default, tapping an element selects that element and deselects the previous elements.  The `'additive' selection type toggles the selection state of an element when tapped.`

args.name: type
args.descr: The selection type string; one of `'single'` (default) or `'additive'`.

name: cy.panningEnabled
descr: Get or set whether panning is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables panning; a falsey value disables it.

name: cy.userPanningEnabled
descr: Get or set whether panning by user events (e.g. dragging the graph background) is enabled.

formats.descr: Get whether user panning is enabled.
Set whether user panning is enabled

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables panning; a falsey value disables it.

name: cy.zoomingEnabled
descr: Get or set whether zooming is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables zooming; a falsey value disables it.

name: cy.userZoomingEnabled
descr: Get or set whether user zooming by user events (e.g. mouse wheel, pinch-to-zoom) is enabled.

formats.descr: Get whether user zooming is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables user zooming; a falsey value disables it.

name: cy.boxSelectionEnabled
descr: Get or set whether box selection is enabled. If enabled along with panning, the user must hold down one of shift, control, alt, or command to initiate box selection.

formats.descr: Get whether box selection is enabled.
Set whether box selection is enabled.

args.name: bool
args.descr: A truthy value enables box selection; a falsey value disables it.

name: cy.pan
descr: Get or set the panning position of the graph.

args.name: renderedPosition
args.descr: The rendered position to pan the graph to.

name: cy.panBy
descr: Relatively pan the graph by a specified rendered position vector.

args.name: renderedPosition
args.descr: The rendered position vector to pan the graph by.

name: cy.fit
descr: Pan and zooms the graph to fit to a collection.

formats.descr: Fit to all elements in the graph.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The collection to fit to.

args.name: padding
args.descr: An amount of padding (in rendered pixels) to have around the graph (default 0).

name: cy.minZoom
descr: Get or set the minimum zoom level.

args.name: zoom
args.descr: The new minimum zoom level to use.

name: cy.maxZoom
descr: Get or set the maximum zoom level.

args.name: zoom
args.descr: The new maximum zoom level to use.

name: cy.zoom
descr: Get or set the zoom level of the graph.

args.name: level
args.descr: The zoom level to set.

args.name: options

fields.name: level
fields.descr: The zoom level to set.

fields.name: position
fields.descr: The position about which to zoom.

fields.name: renderedPosition
fields.descr: The rendered position about which to zoom.

args.descr: The options for zooming.

name: cy.viewport
descr: Set the viewport state (pan & zoom) in one call.

args.name: zoom
args.descr: The zoom level to set.

args.name: pan
args.descr: The pan to set (a rendered position).

name: cy.center
descr: Pan the graph to the centre of a collection.

formats.descr: Centre on all elements in the graph.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The collection to centre upon.

name: cy.reset
descr: Reset the graph to the default zoom level and panning position.

name: cy.width
descr: Get the on-screen width of the viewport in pixels.

name: cy.height
descr: Get the on-screen height of the viewport in pixels.

name: cy.extent
descr: Get the extent of the viewport, a bounding box in model co-ordinates that lets you know what model positions are visible in the viewport.

name: ani.play
descr: Requests that the animation be played, starting on the next frame. If the animation is complete, it restarts from the beginning.

name: ani.playing
descr: Get whether the animation is currently playing.

name: ani.apply
descr: Apply the animation at its current progress.

name: ani.applying
descr: Get whether the animation is currently applying.

name: ani.pause
descr: Pause the animation, maintaining the current progress.

name: ani.stop
descr: Stop the animation, maintaining the current progress and removing the animation from any associated queues.

name: ani.progress
descr: Get or set how far along the animation has progressed.

formats.name: ani.progress
formats.descr: Get the progress of the animation in percent.

formats.name: ani.progress
formats.descr: Set the progress of the animation in percent.

args.name: progress
args.descr: The progress in percent (i.e. between 0 and 1 inclusive) to set to the animation.

formats.name: ani.time
formats.descr: Get the progress of the animation in milliseconds.

formats.name: ani.time
formats.descr: Set the progress of the animation in milliseconds.

args.name: time
args.descr: The progress in milliseconds (i.e. between 0 and the duration inclusive) to set to the animation.

formats.name: ani.rewind
formats.descr: Rewind the animation to the beginning.

formats.name: ani.fastforward
formats.descr: Fastforward the animation to the end.

name: ani.completed
descr: Get whether the animation has progressed to the end.

name: ani.reverse
descr: Reverse the animation such that its starting conditions and ending conditions are reversed.

name: ani.promise
descr: Get a promise that is fulfilled with the specified animation event.

formats.descr: Get a promise that is fulfilled with the next `completed` event.
Get a promise that is fulfilled with the specified animation event.

args.name: animationEvent
args.descr: A string for the event name; `completed` or `complete` for completing the animation or `frame` for the next frame of the animation.

name: layout.run
descr: Start running the layout.

name: layout.stop
descr: Stop running the (asynchronous/discrete) layout.

name: layout.on
descr: Listen to events that are emitted by the layout.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(event)

fields.name: event
fields.descr: The event object.

args.descr: The handler function that is called when one of the specified events occurs.

formats.descr: Get a promise that is resolved when the layout emits the first of any of the specified events.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

formats.descr: Listen to events that are emitted by the layout, and run the handler only once.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: data
args.descr: A plain object which is passed to the handler in the event object argument.

args.name: function(event)

fields.name: event
fields.descr: The event object.

args.descr: The handler function that is called when one of the specified events occurs.

formats.descr: Remove event handlers on the layout.

args.name: events
args.descr: A space separated list of event names.

args.name: handler
args.descr: A reference to the handler function to remove.

name: layout.removeAllListeners
descr: Remove all event handlers on the layout.

formats.descr: Emit one or more events on the layout.

args.name: events
args.descr: A list of event names to emit (either a space-separated string or an array).

args.name: extraParams
args.descr: An array of additional parameters to pass to the handler.
